data.title: Added two new difficulties to allies-05a
data.body: Also fixed #8353.

data.title: (Abandoned idea) Undisguised spy can infiltrate buildings
data.body: The spy should be disguised to be able to infiltrate buildings.

data.title: Fixed a crash in color picker logic when using the in-game editor
data.body: Fixes #8341

data.title: make TD mission objective punctuation consistent
data.body:
some mission objectives end with ".", most don't - this removes the punctuation for consistency

some nod objectives end with an exclamation mark, I kept that even though it is inconsistent through nod missions as well

edit: I addded fullstops to all objectives and replaced exclamation marks in the process

data.title: Some hotkeys don't work with azerty keyboards
data.body:
Sorry to bother you with this problem (since it should only affect a very few players, those who have an AZERTY keyboard) but some hotkeys don't seem to work at all on these keyboards, especially the . fullstop.

http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=05&day=31#17:19:19

data.title: Fix actor placement and typo in nod06a
data.body:
I have no idea why those actors are stuck. The E2's just a little to the north are in the absolute same position relative to the tree and aren't stuck.

Fixes #8343 
Fixes #8344

data.title: [Render] Tooltips / Chatwindow is rendered every tick...
data.body:
i noticed that the Batches are get kicked up when i press (ONLY) Enter (to write some things) but the Chatwindow is every tick the Same. When im closing the Window, the batches goes down.

The Same can be noticed on the Tooltip... hold a cursor over your units... tooltip shows up and batches goes also up... moving the cursor away tooltip-batches goes down...

it seems the engine is rendering things which are every ticks the same... :/

IDEA: we could render the tooltips / window only once and update it only when it changes...

data.title: Trying to change player color in editor causes CTD
data.body:
Crash to desktop via fatal error if the player color is clicked in settings, while in the ingame editor.

Steps to reproduce:
-Open the ingame map editor
-Navigate to settings
-Try to change player color

Contents of exception.log: 

```
Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20150531
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException`: Het doel van een aanroep heeft een uitzondering veroorzaakt.
Inner Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: De objectverwijzing is niet op een exemplaar van een object ingesteld.
     bij OpenRA.OwnerInit..ctor(Player player)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.ColorPickerLogic..ctor(Widget widget, World world, HSLColor initialColor, Action`1 onChange, WorldRenderer worldRenderer)
   bij System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   bij System.Reflection.RuntimeConstructorInfo.Invoke(BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   bij OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateUsingArgs(ConstructorInfo ctor, Dictionary`2 args)
   bij OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateObject[T](String className, Dictionary`2 args)
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.<PostInit>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0(String l)
   bij System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectArrayIterator`2.MoveNext()
   bij System.Linq.Buffer`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 source)
   bij System.Linq.Enumerable.ToArray[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.PostInit(WidgetArgs args)

   bij OpenRA.Game.LoadWidget(World world, String id, Widget parent, WidgetArgs args)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.ColorPickerLogic.ShowColorDropDown(DropDownButtonWidget color, ColorPreviewManagerWidget preview, World world)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.SettingsLogic.<InitDisplayPanel>c__AnonStorey5.<>m__D(MouseInput _)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ButtonWidget.HandleMouseInput(MouseInput mi)

   bij OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Whole screen flickers especially in TS mod
data.body:
I'm trying the (awesome!) Tiberian Sun mod and the whole screen is flickering (in self-compiled OpenRA on Linux). In TS mod the whole screen (or map, it's hard to tell) flickers when in the main game menu (with the map in the background) and in the game itself. It looks like the color of the whole screen is changing to black.

I'm getting some flickering in RA mod too and even in the recent playtest. In the game, when I go to the menu (with Esc) unrevealed terrain appears for short periods of time. When I return to main menu I get the flickering again (black color appearing) but it seems that it is in longer period then in TS mod.

Noting is happening when I play in windowed mode but in fullscreen and pseudo-fullscreen, screen flickers.

I'm using Lubuntu 15.04 (Vivid Vervet) with LXDE desktop environment, Openbox windows-manager, LightDM display manager and the following configuration:

Graphics card info (`lspci | grep -i graphics`):

```
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Core Processor Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02)
```

CPU info (`cat /proc/cpuinfo | head -n 27`):

```
processor       : 0
vendor_id       : GenuineIntel
cpu family      : 6
model           : 37
model name      : Intel(R) Core(TM) i5 CPU       M 480  @ 2.67GHz
stepping        : 5
microcode       : 0x2
cpu MHz         : 1599.000
cache size      : 3072 KB
physical id     : 0
siblings        : 4
core id         : 0
cpu cores       : 2
apicid          : 0
initial apicid  : 0
fpu             : yes
fpu_exception   : yes
cpuid level     : 11
wp              : yes
flags           : fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush dts acpi mmx fxsr sse sse2 ss ht tm pbe syscall nx rdtscp lm constant_tsc arch_perfmon pebs bts rep_good nopl xtopology nonstop_tsc aperfmperf pni dtes64 monitor ds_cpl vmx est tm2 ssse3 cx16 xtpr pdcm pcid sse4_1 sse4_2 popcnt lahf_lm ida arat dtherm tpr_shadow vnmi flexpriority ept vpid
bugs            :
bogomips        : 5319.60
clflush size    : 64
cache_alignment : 64
address sizes   : 36 bits physical, 48 bits virtual
power management:
```

OpenGL version (`glxinfo | grep "OpenGL"`):

```
OpenGL vendor string: Intel Open Source Technology Center
OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ironlake Mobile 
OpenGL version string: 2.1 Mesa 10.5.2
OpenGL shading language version string: 1.20
OpenGL extensions:
OpenGL ES profile version string: OpenGL ES 2.0 Mesa 10.5.2
OpenGL ES profile shading language version string: OpenGL ES GLSL ES 1.0.16
OpenGL ES profile extensions:
```

Mono version (`mono --version`):

```
Mono JIT compiler version 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu4)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com
    TLS:           __thread
    SIGSEGV:       altstack
    Notifications: epoll
    Architecture:  amd64
    Disabled:      none
    Misc:          softdebug 
    LLVM:          supported, not enabled.
    GC:            sgen
```

I see that the Mono version is quite old (Feb 2014), so I have tried the new one:

```
Mono JIT compiler version 4.0.1 (tarball Tue May 12 15:39:23 UTC 2015)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com
    TLS:           __thread
    SIGSEGV:       altstack
    Notifications: epoll
    Architecture:  amd64
    Disabled:      none
    Misc:          softdebug 
    LLVM:          supported, not enabled.
    GC:            sgen
```

However, I get the same flickering in playtest. Now it is visible in the main menu right away without going to game first. I was not able to check bleed branch because with `make all` I get:

```
CSC fixheader.exe
error CS8001: Warning as Error: SDK path could not be resolved
Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
Makefile:257: recipe for target 'fixheader.exe' failed
make: *** [fixheader.exe] Error 1
```

This happens after successful `make dependencies` preceded by `make clean` (and `git clean -f`). It might be caused by some mess in the system due to the packages from external sources but I don't know.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Step in the direction of RA2 paratroopers
data.body:
`Parachute` effect replaced by an in-world actor implementing the `Parachute` activity. That activity grants a `parachute` upgrade, changes the actor's targetability and moves the actor towards the ground. Once on the ground, the `parachute` upgrade is revoked.

The `parachute` upgrade is consumed by `WithParachute`, an upgradable trait that renders the parachute (similar to `WithIdleOverlay`) and the shadow (using `IRender`).

Parachuted actors are made uncrushable and unable to crush.

Two further small adjustments have been made to the `SetPosition` placement functions on `Mobile` and `Crate` traits.

Edit: Fixes #2988.

data.title: Fixed all squared range related integer overflows
data.body: Even those not detected by Coverity.

data.title: Simplify and improve shroud rendering performance.
data.body: This pr uses #8221 and the supporting changes in #8226 and #8299 to dramatically simplify the shroud rendering code.  This should also give a significant performance boost.  Only the last commit is part of the actual pr.

data.title: Fixed D2k attack voices and adds 4th variant for fremen voices
data.body:
Closes #8326.

There weren't any `Attack` voices defined in d2k, I'm suprised it even worked for vehicles, possibly due to `AttackMove`.

data.title: Fixed a missing call to base clase in OpenRA.Editor.OnPaint
data.body: This doesn't seem to fix anything. Still it was violating the API contract.

data.title: Fixed an unintentional integer overflow in Aircraft.GetRepulsionForce
data.body: Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed an unintentional integer overflow in AttackBase
data.body: Not sure how bad this is, but it surely doesn't sound good. http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/190.html

data.title: Fixed an explicit NullReferenceException in ExtractLanguageStringsCommand
data.body: I should probably give this a second go now that we have more possibly interested non-native English speaking developers for testing and review.

data.title: Added more useful exceptions to the command line utility replay parser
data.body: This was picked up by Coverity as a "Dereference null return value" violation. As NREs are often cryptic to read by users I decided to add more appropriate ones with additional context.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException in GameTimeLogic
data.body: The `GAME_TIMER` label was meant to be optional as seen in the code above. Never crashed, because everyone copy & pasted the RA chrome MiniYaml definitions.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException in WorldTooltipLogic
data.body: Found by Coverity Scan. Introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6613. Not sure how likely it is to happen.
